content: How can I help you today?
I’ve just been struggling with sleep lately. I can’t seem to shut my brain off at night, and it’s starting to really wear me down. My partner suggested I talk to someone, so here I am.

It sounds challenging to feel worn down by sleepless nights, especially when your mind is constantly active. It's good to hear that your partner cares and encouraged you to reach out. What do you feel might be contributing to the struggle, or what have you tried so far to help with sleep?

I think a lot of it is work stress. I’m worried about job security, and it’s hard to stop thinking about what could happen. At night, my mind just doesn’t stop spiraling, and I usually end up on my phone, which I know probably makes things worse.

Work stress and uncertainty can be really overwhelming, especially when it follows you into the space where you're trying to relax. It's understandable that you reach for your phone during those moments—sometimes distractions can feel like a way to quiet your thoughts. What's been your experience with trying to create calm or set boundaries around sleep, if anything?

Honestly, I haven’t really figured that part out. I’ve thought about putting the phone down earlier, but it feels impossible when my mind is racing like that. I just don’t know how to turn it all off.

It sounds frustrating to feel stuck in that cycle—wanting to calm your mind but finding it hard to break the habit when it feels like the only comfort during those moments. It takes a lot of self-awareness to even recognize the impact of these choices, and you're clearly reflecting on it. What do you think might make it easier to find that sense of calm at night?

Honestly, I don’t have a clear answer. Maybe if I had something else to focus on—something that didn’t keep my mind spinning, like my phone does—it might help. But I don’t know where to start or what would actually work for me.

It’s natural to feel unsure about where to start, especially when you’re managing stress and experimenting with change. You're already thinking about shifting your focus to something more calming, which could be a meaningful step forward. If you had a way to unwind or relax before bed that gave your mind some peace, how do you imagine that could feel for you?

It’d probably feel like a huge relief. Just being able to get some rest without my brain going a mile a minute would make such a difference. I just don’t know if I can actually get to that point with everything going on right now.

The weight of everything happening in your life can make the idea of change feel daunting, and it's natural to have some doubts. At the same time, the relief you're imagining—a calmer mind and better rest—sounds like something you really value. What do you think would help you believe that this kind of progress is possible, even with everything you're managing?

It’s hard to believe it’s possible right now with all the stress, but maybe if I could take even small steps that actually worked, it’d give me some hope. I guess I just don’t know what that first step would be or how to stick to it when I feel so stuck in my head.

It can be overwhelming to think about change when stress is so present, but focusing on small, manageable steps is a thoughtful idea. Even one small thing could be a powerful way to start creating some hope and momentum. Is there anything you’ve considered trying—or even just been curious about—that might feel like a realistic first step for you right now?

Maybe I could try putting my phone down for a little bit before bed, even if it’s just for a short amount of time to start. I honestly don’t know what I’d do instead, but I think keeping it small at first might make it feel less impossible.

Starting small is a great idea—it makes change feel more approachable and less overwhelming. Even just putting the phone down for a short time is a meaningful first step. Finding something else to focus on might help ease your mind during that time. Have you thought about any activities or practices that could help you relax or feel grounded before bed?

Maybe I could try something simple, like reading or writing down some of my thoughts to clear my head. I’m not sure if it’ll help, but it might be better than endlessly scrolling. I guess I just need to figure out what would actually feel calming instead of adding more stress.

Reading or writing down your thoughts could be a gentle way to shift your focus and start clearing your mind. It's great that you're open to exploring something that might feel calming and help you break away from the scrolling cycle. It’s okay to experiment and see what resonates with you. Would you like help thinking about how to ease into trying one of these ideas, or do you feel ready to take those first steps on your own?
I think I’m okay to start with those ideas for now and see how it goes. I’ll try to take it one small step at a time. Thank you for letting me talk through all of this—it’s been helpful.
